posts.post_content:
This is what happens when you put a [Steel Wall](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Steel Wall), a [Wall of Hope](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Wall of Hope) and [Noble Stand](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Noble Stand) in a bowl, refine everything with a decent creature type, then add a pinch of awesome and finally stir everything up.  
  
Oh, and keep in mind he's cúmulative with himself. This means if you cast him on turn one and fetch two further captains with [Ranger of Eos](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Ranger of Eos), you'll get 6 life each time you block with one of them.
posts.html:

Posted By: majinara (2/4/2010 5:34:19 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
5/5.  
  
This is one of the best cards in the set, imo. 0/4 for 1 mana makes for a nice blocker. Plus he gets you life whenever he blocks, and if you have other defenders, you gain even more life.  
  
  
@ zevilmustache  
  
It would do well in a control type deck that wants to buy time before it can control the game. In most cases, the only things that will get around this guy are fliers or really huge creatures (the latter which you usually see from green), and you should have wall of denial out by then. Other than that, they have to use removal (and not all removal will get him; disfigure and bolt can't kill it), and a 1-drop that attracts removal from your opponent is awesome.
posts.html:
5/5.

This is one of the best cards in the set, imo. 0/4 for 1 mana makes for a nice blocker. Plus he gets you life whenever he blocks, and if you have other defenders, you gain even more life.


@ zevilmustache

It would do well in a control type deck that wants to buy time before it can control the game. In most cases, the only things that will get around this guy are fliers or really huge creatures (the latter which you usually see from green), and you should have wall of denial out by then. Other than that, they have to use removal (and not all removal will get him; disfigure and bolt can't kill it), and a 1-drop that attracts removal from your opponent is awesome.
